test-kitchen tip: hardwood lump charcoal is made from pure wood (with no additives or fillers). as the name suggests, this type of charcoal comes in irregularly shaped lumps, unlike the uniformly shaped charcoal briquettes. look for hardwood lump charcoal at natural foods stores, grill shops, and online at sites such as kindlin.com and wickedgoodcharcoal.com.: 1

"my taste in food is pretty simple," writes sara hainsworth of frederick, maryland. "i’m a meat-and-potatoes — and chocolate — kind of person. my husband, greg, and i cook together a lot, which is fun and makes weeknight dinners and cooking for friends easier to manage now that we’re starting our own family. i worked before our son, william, was born, but as my husband says, william is my boss now. so i count on these quick, dependably good dishes more than ever.": 1
